abstracts.cdata!:
At least twenty-five percent of each of
            the four loans will be on-lent to help finance the foreign
            exchange cost of imported equipment for investments in
            industrial sub-projects with a labor-intensive orientation
            (defined as projects creating employment at a maximum cost
            per job of US$31,000) and the remainder of each of the four
            loans will be on-lent for the same purpose (but without the
            specific labor-intensive emphasis) to small- and
            medium-sized industrial sub-projects in the Autonomous
            Province of Kosovo and the Republics of Bosnia-Herzegovina,
            Montenegro and Macedonia. Normally, the maximum sub-loan
            will be US$4 million equivalent and only sub-projects
            costing US$15 million equivalent or less will be financed.
            There will be no limit on sub-loan or project size for
            labor-intensive sub-projects. Sub-projects involving
            domestic joint ventures up to a total cost of US$20 million
            equivalent may be financed. There are no special risks
            associated with the loans.
